availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Fletcher Donaldson and Nancy Harper Donaldson. Student in Bath County in 1850. Resident in Bath County in 1860. Resident in Bath County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 57B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 20.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 58A.
Twelfth Manuscript Census of the United States (1900), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Sharpsburg, Enumeration District 0002, p. 5.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film # 994028: Bath, Bell, Boone, Bourbon, Boyd, Boyle, 1853, p. 240 of 931 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, “Richard Donaldson (1842-1920)," Memorial # 28817725, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28817725/richard-donaldson (accessed February 8, 2021).
